arm_group.arm_group_label: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease
arm_group.description: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease between 2012 and 2013 in Samsung Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute kidney injury (AKI) is a major complication after cardiac surgery and has been
      reported to be associated with adverse outcome. Previous studies have reported that the
      incidence of AKI in patients undergoing surgery for congenital heart disease is as high as
      42% and AKI increase the patient mortality, intensive care unit stay and hospital stay.
      Previous studies have reported several risk factors for AKI after congenital heart surgery,
      however, perioperative variables including anesthesia-related factors have not been
      evaluated fully. Therefore, the investigators attempt to find out independent risk factors
      regarding perioperative variables.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence, Risk Factors, and Risk Model of Acute Kidney Injury in Pediatric Patients Who Undergoing Surgery for Congenital Heart Disease
clinical_study.condition: Patients Undergoing Surgery for Congenital Heart Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
Acute kidney injury (AKI) is a major complication after cardiac surgery and has been
      reported to be associated with adverse outcome. Previous studies have reported that the
      incidence of AKI in patients undergoing surgery for congenital heart disease is as high as
      42% and AKI increase the patient mortality, intensive care unit stay and hospital stay.
      Previous studies have reported several risk factors for AKI after congenital heart surgery,
      however, perioperative variables including anesthesia-related factors have not been
      evaluated fully. Therefore, the investigators attempt to find out independent risk factors
      regarding perioperative variables including pulmonary hypertension, use of nitric oxide, use
      of hydroxyethyl starch, perioperative medication, hemodynamic variables.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease between 2012 and 2013 in
             Samsung Medical Center

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  incomplete data for creatinine, estimated glomerular filtration rate, or urine output
             required to diagnose acute kidney injury

          -  patients who expired within 24 hours after surgery

study_pop.textblock:
patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease between 2012 and 2013 in
        Samsung Medical Center

intervention.arm_group_label: patients who underwent surgery for congenital heart disease

clinical_study.official_title: Incidence, Risk Factors, and Risk Model of Acute Kidney Injury in Pediatric Patients Who Undergoing Surgery for Congenital Heart Disease

primary_outcome.description: acute kidney injury diagnosis defined by RIFLE criteria (for Risk, Injury, Failure, Loss, End-stage kidney disease) during seven days after surgery
primary_outcome.measure: acute kidney injury diagnosis defined by RIFLE criteria

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Acute kidney injury as defined by AKIN (acute kidney injury network) criteria within 48 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.measure: Acute kidney injury as defined by AKIN (acute kidney injury network) criteria

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
